page.title: 05SHOPPING FACILITIES IN BRILL
page.content: The general stores are V.G.,Londis and Cook's which is also a newsagent selling national and local newspapers. The staff work on average 40 hours a week.All the shops are licenced to sell alcoholic drinks and spirits.They have deliveries of bread every day and fresh foods every week.Cook's have been in business for 100 years and V.G.for 50 years.The Brill butcher sells all kinds of meat:beef,chicken,lamb,pork etc..He also sells eggs,fish and tinned and frozen vegetables.The suppliers are ughton's,Rixon's,F.M.C. Christmas meat, Danish,Wilksere and Westgates.The antique shop was previously a dairy.It sells good furniture,jewellery,coins, china,stamps and books.Once a month there is an antique fair in the Memorial Hall.There is a Fiat dealer in Brill,also garage services.There is one petrol pump in Temple Street.
